notes: All 36 canonical map locations plus Camp Coffin.
key_resources lists 2-5 resources that define the location and drive scenario objectives.
resources object only contains non-zero values for those key resources.
Sub-locations (Red Lantern Cantina, Automat, Monte Haul) removed — they appear IN locations, not as locations.
glasswind-mesa removed — it is a terrain type template, not a canonical named place.

locations.name: Diablo
locations.description: Diablo booms by decree, greed, and violence. The rail line used to keep it fed. The guns keep it profitable.
locations.atmosphere: Noise, commerce, and a crook under every counter
rumors: The Company bought the sheriff's badge and the man wearing it.
A sealed auction lot contains something that screams at night.
Three factions have a truce here. Nobody trusts it.
notes: Primary boomtown. Everything and everyone passes through Diablo.

locations.name: Camp Coffin
locations.description: Monster Rangers HQ. Canvas tents, campfires, and corrals where monsters and humans find uneasy peace.
locations.atmosphere: The one place where everyone watches the same horizon
rumors: A Ranger returned from a patrol changed. Nobody says how.
The corral's newest resident doesn't eat.
HQ has a locked room nobody asks about.
notes: Monster Rangers faction hub. Medical and supply anchor.

locations.name: Fort Plunder
locations.description: Liberty Corps holds this fort with force and procedure. Every brick is policy. Every bullet is filed.
locations.atmosphere: Authority enforced at gunpoint
rumors: There are prisoners here nobody has charged with anything.
The Corps is stockpiling something the fort can't officially hold.
A gate guard went missing and was replaced by someone who looks too much like him.
notes: Liberty Corps stronghold. High weapons density. Combat-ready location.

locations.name: Fortune
locations.description: Fortune was richer once. The veins are thinning and everyone knows it, but nobody will say it first.
locations.atmosphere: Desperation dressed as optimism
rumors: The last good vein is still there — three men died over a map to it.
The assay office is bribing surveyors to underreport.
Fortune will be a ghost town in a year. Everyone is already stealing everything.
notes: Silver boom town going bust. Claim-jumping and extraction conflict.

locations.name: River City
locations.description: Where the river runs, trade follows. River City is the biggest market in the canyon and the most dangerous fish market in the world.
locations.atmosphere: Commerce and river rot in equal measure
rumors: The river Kelpie accepts tribute. The dockmaster keeps track of who hasn't paid.
Three major trade routes converge here. Every faction wants a cut.
Something is poisoning the upstream water. The town council is ignoring it.
notes: Trade hub. Water and food drive objectives here.

locations.name: Bayou City
locations.description: Built on stilts over black water. The food is good, the spirits are better, and the crocodiles are unavoidable.
locations.atmosphere: Damp, loud, and very well-armed
rumors: The best moonshine in the canyon comes from here. Several people have died proving it.
There is a Kelpie in the main channel who has a name and a regular schedule.
The bayou contains ruins nobody has reached the bottom of.
notes: Moonshine trade node. Wet terrain. Crocodile pressure.

locations.name: Cowtown
locations.description: The canyon's largest working cattle town. The herds are everything here. Losing cattle is losing the town.
locations.atmosphere: Dust, dung, and the sound of men who live and die by livestock
rumors: Something is picking off the herd at night. Tracks don't match any known predator.
The auctioneer is running a second auction after dark with different merchandise.
A Dire Wolf pack has been following the same herd for three weeks.
notes: Primary livestock location. Pack animal objectives natural here.

locations.name: Santos Grin
locations.description: A trade town that runs on money and secrets. Santos Grin smiles because it knows something you don't.
locations.atmosphere: The smell of money and the sound of dice
rumors: Three major faction debts are held by the same lender here.
The private vaults contain one item that every faction would kill for.
Santos Grin's tax collector is never robbed. Nobody asks why.
notes: Finance and gambling hub. Gildren and covert objectives.

locations.name: Ratsville
locations.description: The place you end up when everywhere else won't have you. Ratsville doesn't ask questions and doesn't remember answers.
locations.atmosphere: Desperation, rotgut, and the sound of rats
rumors: The Wererats run Ratsville. The human residents just don't admit it.
There are three tons of unregistered lead ammunition stored somewhere under the town.
Ratsville has no law. It also has no unsolved crimes.
notes: Lawless zone. Contraband and ammunition objectives.

locations.name: Quinne Jimmy
locations.description: A frontier repair stop. Nothing glamorous. Everything necessary. They fix machines here and nobody asks where they came from.
locations.atmosphere: Grease, rust, and the pride of keeping things running
rumors: The repair shop has a basement room with no official inventory.
Quinne Jimmy was two people. One of them is still here, technically.
The Rusters that hunt here seem to avoid certain parts of the junkyard.
notes: Salvage and repair node. Spare parts objectives.

locations.name: Dustbuck
locations.description: Dustbuck is dying in real time. The well is foul, the silver is gone, and whoever is left is waiting for permission to leave.
locations.atmosphere: Hot, silent, and slowly being reclaimed by the canyon
rumors: The last assay report was falsified. There's still something here.
Three families refused to leave. They are still here in some form.
Dustbuck's water turned foul the same week the main mine collapsed.
notes: Ruined town. Fouled resource and abandoned objective focus.

locations.name: Fool Boot
locations.description: Nobody plans to stop in Fool Boot. They stop anyway. Something about the town makes it hard to leave before sunrise.
locations.atmosphere: Unremarkable by design
rumors: Every person who has stayed more than three nights here has lost something they can't describe.
The innkeeper doesn't sleep. Has never slept.
Fool Boot appears in the wrong place on three different maps.
notes: Minor waystation. Liminal location with strange reputation.

locations.name: Deerhoof
locations.description: A working settlement at the edge of the canyon's good land. People here grow things. The canyon is always looking at their fences.
locations.atmosphere: Hard work and harder nights
rumors: The hunting lodge has a guest room that hasn't been rented out in six years.
Something has been following the herd. The tracks are too big for any known predator.
A new Monsterology team arrived last week claiming to be conducting a census.
notes: Frontier farmland. Livestock and food-driven scenarios.

locations.name: Huck
locations.description: Huck is a small outpost that keeps watch on a corner of the canyon nobody else wants to watch. They have found Thyr nearby and told almost nobody.
locations.atmosphere: Small, vigilant, and sitting on something valuable
rumors: The crystal vein outside Huck goes deeper than any surveyor has mapped.
Huck's garrison has been quietly reinforced. Nobody official will say why.
There's a body buried under the outpost floor that the current garrison doesn't know about.
notes: Small outpost with Thyr discovery. Extraction conflict potential.

locations.name: Little Rica
locations.description: Little Rica has the ore. It has always had the ore. The problem is everyone else also knows it has the ore.
locations.atmosphere: Rich ground, poor security
rumors: A survey team found a second seam below the main mine and hasn't reported it officially.
Little Rica's guards are paid by three different parties simultaneously.
The Thyr crystals here are forming in patterns that look like script.
notes: High-value extraction target. Silver and Thyr objectives.

locations.name: Plata
locations.description: Plata runs on silver. Everything in Plata has a price and that price is in silver. The armed vaults have never been successfully robbed. Yet.
locations.atmosphere: Precision, wealth, and heavy security
rumors: The assay house runs a second set of books. The first set is for the authorities.
Plata's lead supply comes from somewhere that nobody in town will name.
A vault shipment is moving in three days. Multiple parties know the route.
notes: Silver trade town. High-value extraction and control objectives.

locations.name: Silverpit
locations.description: The pit goes deep and the machines are old. Silverpit is productive as long as nothing breaks. Things break constantly.
locations.atmosphere: Noise, ore dust, and the smell of hot metal
rumors: The hoist mechanism has been 'repaired' seventeen times. It has never actually been fixed.
Three Automats went into the lower pit two months ago. They haven't come back.
There is silver in the pit walls that doesn't appear on the survey. Someone is mining it privately.
notes: Working mine. Salvage and mechanical objectives.

locations.name: Mindshaft
locations.description: Mindshaft went too deep and found something that wasn't ore. The mine is officially closed. People still go in. Most come back.
locations.atmosphere: Wrong echoes and crystal light from the wrong direction
rumors: The collapse at level seven was not structural. Something pushed it from below.
Thyr crystals grow faster in Mindshaft than anywhere else in the canyon.
The last crew to survey level nine communicated in a dialect nobody recognized.
notes: Dangerous deep mine. Thyr-heavy. Ritual and horror objectives.

locations.name: Crackpits
locations.description: The ground cracked open here and never closed. Thyr vents make the air shimmer. The pits themselves seem to be getting wider.
locations.atmosphere: Unstable light and the smell of something burning underground
rumors: The cracks are widening by two feet per week. Someone is measuring them and not reporting.
Monsterology has a collection camp at the edge of the pits. They won't say what they're collecting.
A sand worm burst through the main fissure last month. The body was gone by morning.
notes: Highly dangerous. Thyr and ritual objectives dominate here.

locations.name: Gore Mule Drop
locations.description: A steep rail drop where engines scream and brakes turn to prayer. The stones are stained in the shapes of old wrecks.
locations.atmosphere: Metal shriek, carrion wind
rumors: You can hear a train that never arrives if you stand here at dusk.
Something drags wreckage into the ravine to build a nest.
Rail crews leave offerings in grease to keep the grade quiet.
notes: Travel choke point. Escalation-ready ambush terrain.

locations.name: Bandit Buck
locations.description: A half-legit rail stop where freight slows and trouble speeds up. Bandits, deputies, and monsters all know the schedule.
locations.atmosphere: Steam, gun oil, bad timing
rumors: The stop was named after a man who robbed the same train twice.
A ghost freight passes through without stopping — unless it sees you.
Someone here sells keys that open locks you don't own.
notes: Scenario ignition point. Timed arrivals, heists, and standoffs.

locations.name: Grade Grind
locations.description: The maintenance infrastructure the whole rail line depends on. Everything that keeps trains running passes through Grade Grind. So does everything trying to stop them.
locations.atmosphere: Industrial noise and the constant threat of something going wrong
rumors: The rail bridge is load-bearing for three different faction supply lines simultaneously.
Someone has been sabotaging signal equipment. Every investigation comes up empty.
Grade Grind's head engineer hasn't left the property in six months by choice.
notes: Critical infrastructure. Sabotage and control objectives.

locations.name: Ghost Mountain
locations.description: Ghost Mountain is not named poetically. The mountain has ghosts. Dozens of them. They were here before the canyon had a name.
locations.atmosphere: Cold, silent, and listening
rumors: The ghosts on Ghost Mountain are organized. They have a chain of command.
Tzul silver deposits here are older than any known Tzul site.
Three Monsterology teams have gone to Ghost Mountain. None have come back with the same number of people they left with.
notes: High-danger occult location. Ritual and artifact objectives.

locations.name: Heckweed
locations.description: The scrubland here is wrong. The plants grow in the wrong season, in the wrong direction, toward wrong things. The water tastes like something that died in it.
locations.atmosphere: Organic wrongness
rumors: The heckweed itself is mildly toxic if burned. Locals do it anyway.
There's a Thyr crystal cluster under the scrub that nobody can find twice.
Animals born near Heckweed come out wrong. Not dangerously — just wrong.
notes: Corrupted terrain. Tainted ground and fouled resource objectives.

locations.name: Kraise
locations.description: An old claim district named from a misspelled surname that nobody corrects. Deeds change hands, but the ground doesn't care.
locations.atmosphere: Ownership argued over bones
rumors: The original Kraise is buried somewhere in the markers, still holding the first deed.
If you steal here, your footprints appear ahead of you.
A perfect vein is rumored — always one shovel deeper than anyone digs.
notes: Legal conflict zone. Claim jumping and debt scenarios.

locations.name: Lost Yots
locations.description: Lost Yots was a settlement once. Now it is a ruin that is getting larger, not smaller. The walls grow back differently than they fell.
locations.atmosphere: Wrongly rebuilt, badly occupied
rumors: The ruin follows a floor plan that doesn't match any architectural tradition.
Expedition teams keep finding their own abandoned campsites from trips they didn't take.
There are lights in Lost Yots at night. They move with purpose.
notes: Tzul ruins. Undead pressure. Ritual and artifact scenarios.

locations.name: Martygrail
locations.description: A site of contested religious significance where multiple factions insist the sacred ground belongs to them. The ground itself seems to be keeping score.
locations.atmosphere: Competing prayers in a space that listens to all of them
rumors: Three different factions claim Martygrail as holy ground. The space agrees with whichever faction is currently winning.
The donation vault has been empty for years. Something still guards it.
The ritual circle preemptively activates before any faction can attempt it.
notes: Contested sacred site. Ritual and faction ownership objectives.

locations.name: Pallor
locations.description: Pallor is the color of the dust here and the color of the people who stay too long. The springs run foul. The food grows wrong. The land drains everything it touches.
locations.atmosphere: Pale, flat, and depleting
rumors: Pallor gets larger every year. The white dust spreads.
Thyr crystals in Pallor are contaminated with something that doesn't show up on tests.
Animals that drink from Pallor's springs can see things that aren't there. The people who drink twice start to act like those animals.
notes: Desolation zone. Fouled resource and survival scenarios.

locations.name: Rey
locations.description: At the very edge of the mapped canyon, facing the sun. Whatever Rey is watching for, it has not appeared yet. The Thyr spire here grows by an inch a month.
locations.atmosphere: Isolation and something approaching
rumors: The garrison at Rey reports something on the horizon that moves but never gets closer.
The Thyr spire has started humming on days with no wind.
Rey receives no supply shipments and yet has never run short. Nobody explains how.
notes: Remote location. Thyr-heavy. Isolation and escalation scenarios.

locations.name: Sangr
locations.description: The bedrock here is permanently stained. The pools don't evaporate. Things come to Sangr to complete something they started elsewhere.
locations.atmosphere: Heavy air and the metallic taste of old violence
rumors: The pools at Sangr refill overnight regardless of rainfall.
Tzul silver deposits here are already partially refined into something nobody can identify.
The bone ring walls were not built by human hands. The construction method is not known.
notes: Extreme danger occult site. Ritual and sacrificial focus objectives.

locations.name: Skull Water
locations.description: The water source that feeds three downstream settlements. It is also thoroughly contaminated and nobody has managed to fix it for six years.
locations.atmosphere: Malevolent stillness and the sound of something moving in the water
rumors: Skull Water's contamination is getting worse, not better, despite multiple purge attempts.
The Thyr crystals here grew through the contamination, not despite it. They seem stronger.
Something large lives in the main source pool. It has been there for longer than the contamination.
notes: Critical contaminated water source. Fouled resource and purge objectives.

locations.name: Splitglass Arroyo
locations.description: A canyon whose walls are natural glass, formed by something older than the current geology. Sound carries wrong and returns in pieces.
locations.atmosphere: Sharp light, sharper echoes
rumors: Gunshots here come back as different calibers.
A man can whisper at one end and hear it answered from behind him.
Something nests where the glass shines brightest.
notes: Ambush terrain. Echo and sound mechanics encouraged.

locations.name: Tin Flats
locations.description: Flat, featureless, and littered with the abandoned machinery of three failed industries. The Rusters love it here.
locations.atmosphere: Exposed, hot, and full of things that used to work
rumors: Tin Flats has more abandoned equipment than any other location in the canyon. Salvage teams return with less than they bring.
The Rusters on Tin Flats are organized in a way that doesn't match known Ruster behavior.
There are three wellheads here that still pump. Nobody knows what they are pumping.
notes: Ruster territory. Salvage and wrecked engine objectives.

locations.name: Tzulto
locations.description: The largest Tzul ruin in the canyon. The crater wasn't formed by impact — it was removed. The air feels held, as if the place is still listening.
locations.atmosphere: Ancient patience, modern fear
rumors: The crater wasn't formed by impact — it was removed.
Certain words spoken here come out in a different voice.
Monsterology has a map of this place they refuse to share.
notes: High danger Tzul landmark. Lore anchor. Ritual and artifact objectives.

locations.name: Widowflow
locations.description: The river that gives Widowflow its name runs fast, cold, and foul. The clean channel and the foul channel mix unpredictably. Crossing it is how most people die here.
locations.atmosphere: Cold moving water that wants to take you somewhere
rumors: The Kelpies in Widowflow can speak. They use the voices of people who drowned here.
Submerged ruins at low water include structures that predate every known settlement.
The river runs clean above Widowflow and foul below it. Nobody has found the source of contamination.
notes: River crossing hazard. Water and fouled resource objectives.

locations.name: Witches Roost
locations.description: Nobody calls it that officially. The name comes from who you see on the spires at night. Witches Roost is the most Thyr-dense location in the canyon and nobody can hold it.
locations.atmosphere: Maximum danger, maximum reward, zero control
rumors: Witches Roost has been claimed by six different factions. Each one lasted less than a week.
The crystal nests here are alive in some mechanical sense. They rearrange.
There is a complete map of the canyon etched into Witches Roost bedrock. It shows things that haven't happened yet.
notes: Extreme danger. Maximum Thyr density. Only the most desperate scenarios run here.
